job description:
Job Description

Essential Functions

-The Systems and Data Analyst intern is responsible for designing and performing experiments on development products to understand the performance capabilities/limitations of those products

-Analyzing the results of experiments, preparing a summary, and presenting that to the project team, commercial marketing, and R&D leadership

-Analyze and summarize large complex sets of production and/or field data

-Present to technical and non-technical colleagues

Decision making authority

-The intern would report directly to a Systems and Data Analyst Engineer

Specific Scope Data

-Specific tasks will be tailored to the interns experience and abilities

Skills and abilities

-Ability to work both independently and as a member of a cross functional team

-Strong willingness to learn, be mentored, and improve

-Desire to contribute and improve design of new and existing scientific instrumentation products and applications

-Strong customer focus

-Desire to present to others about areas of expertise or of new results

-Aptitude for hands-on experimentation, prototyping, and tinkering

-Basic understanding of experimental design and data analysis techniques

-Experience with R a plus

Qualifications

Required level of education

-The position is open to both undergraduate and graduate students who will have completed at least their Junior year in an ABET accredited degree program prior to starting the internship

Required Area of study/major

-Physics, physical chemistry, chemistry, analytical chemistry, chemical engineering, or related engineering or scientific discipline
